name: Mixed Bag 40 Quiz / Test | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many strings has a modern orchestral harp?
questions.explanation:
46.

	It is made in three basic shapes, arched harps, angular harps and frame harps. Early harps had from 30 to 50 strings.

questions.text: (True or False) The Pampas is a region of Mexico?
questions.explanation:
False.

	It is a plain in Argentina.

questions.text: What kind of wire is produced by Roy Richards' Southwire Corporation?
questions.explanation:
Electrical wire.

	It makes building wire and cable,telecommunications cable and copper and aluminum rods.

questions.text: What toothpaste did Bucky Beaver make famous?
questions.explanation:
Ipana.

	Made by Proctor and Gamble it was advertised as the 'smile of beauty'.

questions.text: In the 1920's the assembly line produced a Model T Ford every how many minutes,seconds,hours or days?
questions.explanation:
10 seconds.

	It was the first mass produced automobile.

questions.text: The United States Marine Corps motto 'semper fidelis' translates to always what?
questions.explanation:
Faithful.

	The Marine Corps comes under the Department of the Navy.It is the oldest organized military or naval body in the United States.

questions.text: Who became president when Harding died in 1923?
questions.explanation:
Coolidge.

	He was a republican who won a term of his own in 1925.

questions.text: Who won the 1960 Best Actress Oscar for 'Butterfield Eight'?
questions.explanation:
Elizabeth Taylor.

	It was an adoption of a O'Hara novel about a high class prostitute.

questions.text: Which sad faced comedial guest hosted the 'Tonight Show' 177 times?
questions.explanation:
Joey Bishop.

	Joan Rivers was second with 93.

Hen.

	It is a female chicken less than one year old.
